0P000019Z2.F.summary: The Fund will seek to achieve capital appreciation by investing principally in equity securities listed on Regulated Markets in Europe. At least 75 percent of The Pan European Equity Fundâs net assets will be invested in issuers based in the EU, Norway and Iceland. The Pan European Equity Fund may also invest in new issues for which application for listing on a Regulated Market in Europe will be sought. The Pan European Equity Fund may hold such securities listed or traded on Regulated Markets worldwide of companies that are not incorporated, listed or traded in Europe but which receive the majority of their total revenue from European countries. The Pan European Equity Fund will not be concentrating on any specific industry sector but will pursue a policy of active stock selection and active country allocation on the Regulated Markets in which it invests.
0P000019Z2.F.manager_bio: Pat founded Attalus Capital in 1998 and serves as the firmâs President and Chief Investment Officer. He oversees all portfolio management and investment activity as Chairman of the Investment Committee and CIO. As President of the firm, Pat is responsible for all non-investment related activities, which he manages in conjunction with the firmâs management committee. Prior to founding Attalus, Pat was responsible for developing the institutional investment management business for Federated Investors. Pat began his investment career in 1984 as an options trader at the SBS Group in Philadelphia.

0P00001N9D.F.summary: The investment seeks to surpass the long-term performance of the DJ Stoxx 600 index. The fund invests more than 50% of net assets in other mutual funds, which invest in various economic sectors from the reference index. It invests at least 75% in equity funds and, to a smaller extent, directly in equities traded on markets in the European Community. The fund may invest up to 10% in debt and money market instruments. The minimum recommended holding period falls between five and seven years.

0P00006Q05.SI.summary: The investment objective of the PRU Pan European Fund (formerly known as PRU European Blue Chip Equity Fund) is to maximise long-term total return by investing in equity and equity-related securities of companies, which are incorporated, or have their area of primary activity, in Europe (including United Kingdom). The Sub-Fund may also invest in depository receipts, including American Depository Receipts (ADRs) and Global Depository Receipts (GDRs), debt securities convertible into common shares, preference shares and warrants.
0P00006Q05.SI.manager_bio: John William Olsen joined M&G in April 2014, and was appointed FM of the Eastspring Pan European Fund, M&G Global Select Fund and M&G Pan European Select Fund in July 2014. He was later appointed deputy manager of the M&G Pan European Select Smaller Companies Fund in July 2016. He joined Danske Capital in 1998 as a FM in domestic Danish equities, and in 2000 also became a global sector analyst focusing on technology and telecommunications. From 2002 he managed non-domestic equity. He has a BA in business economics and a MSc in finance and accounting from Copenhagen Business School.

0P0000J4BU.F.manager_bio:

He previously held a number of positions at the firm, including Europe deputy chief investment officer, director of client services and head of strategy engineering for Europe. The Fund may also invest up to 10% of Net Asset Value in debt securities which may include government and corporate bonds and notes (fixed and floating rate) and commercial paper and may be rated either above or below âinvestment gradeâ by Standard & Poorâs and/or Moodyâs or another internationally recognised credit agency or, if unrated, determined to be equivalent credit quality by the Investment Manager. AVEA.AS.summary: Objective The investment objective is to achieve a return at least equal to the return of the MSCI Europe Index Net EUR, the benchmark and at the same time to realise an ESG score for the fund that is as high as possible. Investment policy. ACTIAM Duurzaam Europees Aandelenfonds invests in equities of listed companies in Member States of the European Union, UK, Norway and Switzerland that deliver an above-average performance within their corporate sector in the field of sustainability. In order to diversify risks, portfolio investments are diversified over countries, industries and companies. An investment in one company may not exceed 10% of the fund assets. The fund may also invest in derivatives, exclusively in equity futures and foreign currency forward contracts. All companies, governments and institutions in the fund are assessed on their environmental, social and governance performance (ESG criteria).

KESVC.AS.long_name: Kempen European Sustainable Value Creation Fund N.V. Klasse N
KESVC.AS.summary: The Fund primarily aims to generate a better long-term total return than the MSCI Europe Net TR Index in euro,comprising capital gains or losses plus net dividend.

SEIF.AS.summary: The objective of the Fund is to achieve a return that is as close as possible to the return on the S&P Dow Jones Sustainability Europe Index ex all*. *Ex all indicates no equities from the alcohol, tobacco, gambling and armaments sectors.
